_id.description: CouchDB doc_id, must be unique across databases (set out-of-band, but does appear in fetched documents)

_rev.example: 1-ef10d96aee9dcb55dcaf5749f529c0c9 (set out-of-band, but does appear in fetched documents)

_ (reserved).description: NOTE: top-level fields within a JSON document containing a name that starts with a _ prefix are reserved for use by CouchDB
_ (reserved).TODO: How would a schema representation capture rules like this?

timestamp.description: Exact time when photo was taken (if known), conforming to RFC 3339
timestamp.TODO: Add a range estimate field for (eg scanned) photos where timestamp not known (look into what ISO8601 offers here)

rating.description: Primary user's rating of the photo. Like XMP specification, -1 may mean reject, 0 would mean unrated (but should be omitted), otherwise 1 (worst) - 5 (best)

title.description: Short summary or artistic title of photo

alt_text.example: Peasants eating a meal in a small, dimly lit house
alt_text.description: Factual caption of image contents, suitable for the sight-impaired and perhaps text-based searching (think )

description.example: Those people, eating their potatoes under the lamplight, have dug the earth with those very hands they put in their dish
description.description: Further details or artistic commentary about the photo

image.description: Useful information about the 'ideal' (e.g. original/canonical) image itself
image.details: Note that, as much as practical, ShutterStem seeks to decouple the concept of a 'photo' and the representation of its pixels (allowing for multiple versions, representations).

original_sha1.description: SHA1 signature of originally imported file. This is very useful for simple (exact) duplicate detection but otherwise useless.

original_filename.description: Filename of originally imported file. Not to be used for linking to original file. Perhaps a useful part of extended duplicate detection, and as a fallback photo title.

aspect.description: Aspect ratio (width divided by height) of image as it would be presented to the user (i.e. rotation applied). Useful for linesetting/layout ahead of pixel data.

exposure.description: Interesting information about how the light was captured

speed.description: Shutter speed, expressed as an integer or fraction of two integers (for human readibility and to keep as rational number)

location.TODO: Administrative or polygon-based location properties, e.g. for when exact(ish) location is not known or shared. Sensor orientation info?

latitude.description: WGS-84 latitude coordinate of camera sensor's position (if set, longitude also required)

longitude.description: WGS-84 longitude coordinate of camera sensor's position (if set, latitude also required)

altitude.description: Height (in meters) of camera sensor above Mean Sea Level
altitude.TODO: Datum unclear from EXIF specification, make sure this is well-defined

system.description: Information about the imaging system used to capture photo
system.TODO: Clarify the distinction between this and exposure? (need a reasonable explanation for separating focal_length aperture)

lens.description: Lens used (typically including make, focal range, aperture range, other type information)

focal_length.description: Focal length of lens while image was captured
focal_length.TODO: Move to exposure? What about 35mm equivalence and sensor size issues?

_attachments.description: CouchDB document attachments, which are used for thumbnails

medium.jpg.description: JPEG thumbnail, oriented for display (i.e. with photo.image.aspect_ratio), with max side dimension of 512 (thus <=1MB when in memory as RGBA)

small.jpg.description: JPEG thumbnail, oriented for display (i.e. with photo.image.aspect_ratio), with max side dimension of 64 (thus <=16kB when in memory as RGBA)
